reviewText: This serum was very thin added to my night creme and it did not mix well I only use pure ingredients so this was not a good additive purchased at a discounted rate for an honest review

This product is great if you are familiar with hyaluronic acid.  It comes from an Asian brand so there are no readable instructions unless you can read Asian characters.  It is super hydrating and comes in a glass vial.  There is a rubber dropper that you attach to the top of the vial.  It is a smart way to conserve material instead of having an eye dropper inside the bottle.  The opening and attachment of the dropper is easy to figure out.  I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest review.  All opinions stated are my own and in no way influenced by the seller.

I like the product itself...it does moisturize and decrease fine lines. However, the entire package and product are in a foreign language so if you did not know how to use this product you have no directions.  It is also a very small quantity...it is in a medicine vial like one would see in a doctors office to draw up shots.  I also took me a minute to figure out how to get it completely open and attach the dispensing top that came with it.  After you pop the top of the vial you have to carefully removed all the metal around the rubber stopper without hurting yourself and then pull off the rubber top and pull over the top the dispenser.  It is a very poor design concept.  As for the serum itself, it is good.  It hydrates without being greasy or oily.  It goes on really smooth and you don't have to use much of it.  It doesn't come in a very large container so it doesn't take up a lot of space but I was really disappointed when I opened the box (which is much bigger than what is inside) and pulled out a small medicine vial.  Hyaluronic acid serum works like it should if you are familiar with it.  If you are not then I would avoid this product as a first time choice so you don't waste too much product and you receive directions that you can read.  I did receive this product at a discounted rate for my honest, unbiased review....I have given just that and my review has not been influenced by anything other than how I liked the product itself.
title: SOONPURE Hyaluronic Acid Serum 10ml

reviewText: Super comfy, doesn't slip or slide.

Decent product, I purchased this from a different retailer.  Mine came new so I didn't have the same problem that some of the reviewers stated.  Super comfortable and necessary for a relaxing bubble bath.

I've taken many nice baths with this pillow already!

There are many pluses to the pillow!  I've had blow up pillows before - they try to float above the water line, which can be a problem depending on the depth of your tub; and they can deflate while you are using them.  I've also had pillows which are more like pillows - the stuffing is soggy and weighs them down, the water they soak up gets cold and can run down your shoulders; and worst of all, the water they hold on to can cause them to mold!

This pillow takes the best parts of both types of pillows and eliminates the cons!  The pillow is a rubbery material with a nice plush top side.  it doesn't soak up water or hold onto water.  But it's stuffed, so it has a nice cushion for your neck and the base of your skull.  It isn't inflated, so it doesn't deflate or try to float.  It'll float if you have it detached, but it comes with 4 large and strong suction cups to hold it in place on the tub wall.

I also love the fold in it so that it contours to the edge of the tub.  This has been fantastic and has me spending more time reading and lounging in the tub!
title: Accmart Bath Pillow 14.5in by 11.4in Beige

reviewText:
I've gone through three beard trimmers in the past few years, and the Norelco 990 is - after two weeks of use - certainly better than the rest in performance, and equal to the best (the Panasonic) in quality.
The adjustment ring is easy-to-use and well-designed, and the swiveling comb/guard above the blades is an excellent design enhancement.  The trimmer cuts smoothly, consistently and evenly.  That you can use this trimmer in either corded or cordless mode is a very big asset.  The carrying case is a nice plus as well.
My only complaint is the pop-up trimmer, which is awkward to engage and seems a bit flimsy.  It works fairly well but is not as easy to use as the pop-up trimmers on the Norelco rotary shavers.
So far, I've used this trimmer every other day for two weeks on a single charge, and the LED shows that the batteries are still three-quarters charged.  This translates to two months on a single charge for me, and that would be excellent.
I'd say it's safe to spend the extra bucks for this model; it's apparently worth it.

The features on this beard timmer are well thought which makes the whole package rather satisfying.
The depth selection mechanism works via rotating ring which means that pressure on the guard won't change the cutting height (like my old trimmer).  The flexing guard is very comfortable and natural feeling.
The unit charges in an hour and holds its charge well.  A long overdue trim (from furry to chic) didn't even register on the battery meter.
I don't find much use for the secondary fine trimming head.  It does cut closer than the primary cutter so you can clean up the trimmed areas without having to shave afterwards.
While not the cheapest, this trimmer is certainly worth the price.  It has a solid feel and an excellent set of features.  Trimming with this Norelco is a very satisfying experience.

This Trimmer is much easier to use and seems to be more powerful than the wahl trimmer I had before. I love the ability to see how much charge is left and to use the cord for 'emergency trimming'. Granted, it's double the price but for an essential tool that I use every other day convenience is very important...
description: This Norelco Acu-Control trimmer provides a precise trim with lifetime self-sharpening blades. The flexing guide comb automatically adjusts to facial contours for a close trim even on difficult areas like the throat and chin. Featuring soft-grip panels, the ergonomic design includes a pop-up trimmer and LCD display with battery charge, full and low indicators. Patented Zoom Ring adjusts to 9 length settings (.6" to .72") to trim hair precisely and evenly. Includes recharging power cord, guard attachment, cleaning brush and travel pouch. Automatic worldwide voltage adjustment. Imported. 6-1/2L"

Perfect for precise, even styling of beard and mustache lengths from stubble to goatee to medium to full, this trimmer has a ring that extends or retracts the cutting blades to nine exact lengths: from 0.06 to 0.72 inch. Key to performance is the guide comb, which flexes and adjusts automatically to facial contours, ensuring that chin and jaw line are cut the same length as cheeks. Self-sharpening chromium-steel blades last the lifetime of the trimmer. The head is hinged for easy cleaning without disassembly. The trimmer works either cordless or with its power cord and needs to be plugged in for 1 hour to fully recharge. An LCD screen shows charging status and signals when the unit needs to be recharged. Comfortable in the hand and handsomely encased in plastic with a lacquered, metallic finish, the trimmer comes with a nylon travel pouch and carries a 60-day, full-satisfaction, money-back guarantee and a two-year warranty against defects. --Fred Brack
title: Norelco T-990 Acu-Control Beard and Mustache Trimmer with LCD, T990

description: No time to scoot to the salon for a pedicure-but your feet aren't fit for your favorite sandals. ArtNaturals' rechargeable electric callus remover takes off those less-than-slightly calluses on your tootsies, leaving them softer and ready to slip into something sexy. Dancing, anyone? And, guys, funky-looking feet are not sexy. Art naturals' rechargeable electric callus remover smoothest off rough edges on your hardworking dogs. Throw on the flip-flops or walk barefoot again in complete confidence our electric callus remover delivers the best in quality and performance, giving you a spa treatment at home. It uses a nickel-cadmium rechargeable battery, providing the power to defeat tough, hard skin on your feet. The electric callus remover features a sleek, modern design that comes with multiple speeds. It can be charged 1,000 times, making it you don't need to use up and throw away batteries. Some people are prone to calluses because they have less cushioning tissue between the bones and skin of their feet. Podiatrists tell us that calluses on feet that are left untreated can lead to additional problems, such as nucleated skin lesions. The electric callus remover is seamless and water resistant. Its rollers can be easily cleaned and changed, and each one is good for up to 10 uses. Pair our electric callus remover with our tea tree foot soak salt for a real Pedi-paradise.
title: ArtNaturals Electric Callus Remover Tool, Most Effective Rechargeable Electronic Pedicure Foot File, Removes The Coarse, Tough Skin on Your Feet with Spa like Treatment

reviewText: Awesome!  My daughter loved it

I love me a good face mask! Especially one that is 100% natural. I have recently learned the benefits of manuka honey and was very happy to see this ingredient on the list. It is also packed with many other ingredients that are great for your skin such as vitamin e oil,  jojoba oil, avocado oil, shea butter and cocoa butter. These are full of skin healing properties. Don't let all the oils fool ya, it isn't oily at all.

My first time using this I thought that it smelled like licorice which kind of through me off because I really hate licorice. I decided to try it again and it smelled like baby powder. Mind blown, wait, nose blown (that doesn't sound right)? I still don't care for the smell too much but baby powder is better that licorice. It is a very thick cream that you apply in a heavy layer and let sit for 20 minutes, rub in what is left after that time and then use a cotton pad to wipe the extra off. I did just that and my skin came out feeling fantastic! It was super duper soft and stayed that way all night and into the morning. I'm impressed and will be using it once a week now.
Although I received this deeply discounted product in exchange for my review, all opinions are my own.

My facial mask arrived yesterday and I wanted to try it today.  It's very easy to apply.  I put it on my face avoiding the eye area.  It says to leave on for 20 minutes.  I left it on probably a little longer.  After relaxing I removed it with a cotton ball and rinsed my face.  My face feels super nourished, soft and smooth.  I really like it's an all natural product with no chemicals.  I will probably use it twice a week.  I would recommend it.

I did receive this product at a discount to give my honest and unbiased opinion.
description: This intensive, deeply penetrating and nutritious mask will nurture, repair and restore dry or damaged skin. Active Manuka Honey with its healing and nourishing properties replenishes moisture, Manuka Oil is a potent antimicrobial, and Rosehip plus other botanical oils with their skin regeneration properties help reduce the look of fine lines and wrinkles. Your intensive and ultra-nourishing skin treatment. For dry and mature skin.
title: Living Nature Natural Manuka Face Masque

reviewText:
Yankauer suction devices are a very necessary tool for helping patients to keep liquids from going into the lungs including saliva.
I am a caregiver for a patient who is strictly NPO which means absolutely nothing by mouth.
This device looks very much like some we have used before from the hospital or medical supply company.
I much prefer the vent to control the suction. I don't think anyone looking for a Yankauer could go wrong with this one if used for adults or even teenagers. I would not use it for an infant or small child as their mouth and throat may be too small for this particular one. As always, check with your healthcare provider before changing any routine currently using.

ordered this suction instrument because the one that came with the suction machine was just an open end on the tubing. This is much easier on the inside of the mouth, doesn't "suck" the tongue & lips like the other tube  does. Very pleased with our purchase!
Please see my comment on the suction hose size. Both items were too large a size for my purposes. Words.

description:
Elite99 Trust: Rocksolid 100% SATISFACTION OR MONEY BACK GUARANTEE, try it risk free. If you have any problem, please feel free to contact us, we will try our best to help you.

Exclusive Brand: Elite99

Item Included: 4 X 15ML Color Gel Polish , 4 X 8ML Color Gel Polish, 1 X 8ML Base Coat, 1 X 8ML Top Coat

Professional Usage

Step 1: Clean nails then push back cuticles and trim nail surface as normal manicure process

Step 2: Apply Elite99 Base coat, and cure under UV lamp for 2-3 minutes, LED lamp for 30-60 seconds

Step 3: Apply Elite99 color coat in a thin application, and cure under UV lamp for 2-3 minutes minutes, LED lamp for 30-60 seconds

Step 4: Apply a second coat, then cure under UV lamp for 2-3 minutes, LED lamp for 30-60 seconds. Apply the third coat if necessary

Step 5: Apply Elite99 Top coat and cure under UV lamp for 2-3 minutes, LED lamp for 30-60 seconds

Step 6: Wipe off tacky surface with cotton soaked with cleanser (Not necessary if you apply no clean top coat)

How To Remove

Step 1: Soak off the nails into acrylic remover for about 5 minutes.

Step 2: Rip down the whole piece of nail enamel gently on each nail.

Warm Tips: The actual colors may be slightly different from the picture because of the lighting and computer color.

Why did the polish chips peels quickly ?

1.Not file the nail slightly. If you want the polish last longer, the first step is important, file the nail and keep them dry.

2.May be your base and top coat are not good quality. Use with Elite99 base and top coat will be better, it is our customers feedback to us, if wear our polish

3.Base and top wear too thick or inhomogeneous then it will peels easily.

reviewText: i have had mine since 1999 im still using it today 2010 . i have never changed the blades and shave with it mostley dry.the gel thing was cool at first but didn't need it after all.the back cover has broken off making it a lil hard to charge so i have to prop it up just right but no biggie im good at it now it broke like 5 years ago the battery last me weeks before charging. i cant say enough its just amazing its a part of me now lol i don't think i could replace it if completley broke.

Having read the glowing reviews from others I was anxious to receive this shaver.  When it finally arrived I made sure to charge it up (takes a long time initially 6-8 hrs.) then finally tried it on a 2 day stubble.  Well, I wasn't impressed with the shave, it was irritating, uncomfortable, and the gel dispensing gadget was awkward to use.  I decided to give this unit the benefit of the doubt because it does state to give it at least 3 weeks for your skin to grow accustom to shaving by this method.

Well, here I am 3 weeks later and I'm still not impressed with the shave.  I particularly get skin iritation along my neck (burns quite a bit) and it's hard to taper shave near side burns. I've also tried different methods of shaving from: in the shower, over the sink, pre-wash and lubricate with skin lubrication lotion, and just flat out dry shave (very uncomfortable!).  Another minus is the charge does not last very long, the shaver peters out after about 2 shaves of about 5-8 minutes (maybe I have a faulty battery?..) I end up having to charge it often.

I now decided to go back to using a Braun shaver, which I should have purchased in the first place!  My previous one was very good, but i decided to give Norleco a chance...oh well, I guess I'll just have to give it to my nephew - he thinks it looks cool, and he just started shaving!

Pros:

Ummm...it looks cool

Cons:

-Terrible shave

-weak charge

-lift and cut system is not effective

-very irritating along neck area

-takes long to fully charge

-lubricating feature very awkward to use and can get expensive

-cleaning is tedious

In my opinion go with a foil system instead like a Braun, Panasonic, or even Remington.  This system is much more effective and although primarily expensive, it will more than make up for the price in a closer shave and not having to buy lubricating lotion, shaving cream and razor blades.

I have been using this razor for a couple of years now and I absolutely love it.  I love it so much that last week it got knocked off my balcony and broke and I went out and got a brand new one.  I just couldn't justify switching to any other razor.  It's great!
description: Norelco's Advantage shaving lotion dispensing Razor

Rechargeable cordless shavers used to be as convenient as it got. With the Advantage shaver, Norelco adds one more perk--shaving lotion automatically dispensed while you shave. Designed for use at the sink or in the shower, the Advantage uses slim cartridges of Nivea shaving lotion or gel, squeezing out a portion when you depress a simple button. Loading the shaver is easy--the lotion cartridges just slide into position under the back hatch. Plus, thanks to its structure, the shaver can simply be rinsed clean under the faucet.

Backing up the innovative shaving lotion feature are the company’s patented Lift and Cut technology and self-sharpening blades for a consistently smooth face. The shaving heads float individually and the entire surface flexes for ideal contouring. A charge of 8 hours delivers 40 minutes of shaving time, and automatic worldwide voltage makes the unit a good traveler. The Advantage comes with a charging stand, a charging indicator light, six samples of lotion, and Norelco’s satisfaction-guarantee. --Emily Bedard
title: Philips Norelco Electric Razor Shaver, Model 6705X

reviewText: This is a comfortable robe; the fabric is nice against the skin. The problem is that it is too large in its smallest size of S/M. The fit is very similar to the one-size-fits-all robes found in hotels. I would have kept it if it were smaller, perhaps in an XS. (For reference, I am 5'7" and generally wear XS or size 4 in most brands.)

First of all, I originally ordered the M/L size and when it arrived, it was gigantic. WAY too large, so I had to go through the process of returning and reordering a smaller size. It would be very helpful if the description gave more sizing information. I am 5'7 and 175 lbs and the S/M is STILL almost too large. Furthermore, the material picks up everything! Pet hair, dirt, leaves...anything that seems like it could stick to the fabric will. And it's difficult to try to pick all that stuff off. Finally, I have really dry skin, so anywhere there is rougher skin (my hands, feet, sometimes legs) the material will snag and catch and it's really annoying. I tried to wear it for a few days, but it's so uncomfortable and I'm going to try to sell it on eBay or something. Very disappointed.
This is a very good price for microfiber.  The shawl collar is a plus.
description: Aquis robes, like our towels, are made of Aquitex, a super absorbent material woven from ultrafine microfibers. The technology behind our microfiber robe enables water to be drawn from your body more quickly and thoroughly than other robes. And it's luxuriously soft and cozy. Step out of the bath and wrap yourself dry in the ultimate comfort.
title: Aquis Microfiber Shawl Collar Robe, White, Small/Medium

reviewText:
I got these for making my own deodorant because I'm tired of ones that don't work or have toxic fillers. It's very simple to do with some Coconut Oil, Bees Wax, Baking Soda and Essetial Oil. Just google and you can find many great recipes.

These are quality deodarant cases. The thickness of the walls is on the thin side, so it will hurt if you don't roll up the deodorant high enough and rub the thin edges on your bare skin. The roll mechanism works well. The one significant advantage I found in these when compared to others, is that you pour through the bottom. Most cases you must pour through the top and it has its problems. If your mix is very liquid, it can come spilling through the bottom, as well as sealing the moving mechanism tight. Having this unit upside down and pouring through the bottom makes for a more professional finished product. The top of the deodorant fills the cap below and takes it shape. When you open the hardened deodorant, it has the desired domed shape. Also you control how much you pour from the bottom, filing to the point where it doesn't effect the spinning mechanism.

Overall there are more expensive cases you can get that have a thicker wall, which will be more comfortable to the skin. However for this price point, these cases are the best as you can pour from the bottom.
Nice Quality

I bought this to fill with my homemade deodorant. The first time I filled a couple I didn't realize you had to fill it from the bottom. So I had a hard time twisting it up. But after I realized that I filled it from the bottom. It came out much better with a nice rounded top. And that feature I really like cause it gives it a more of a professional look.
title: 5 New,, White, Empty, 2.5 oz Deodorant Containers with Caps

reviewText: My natural nails are very long, and I have been silk wrapping them for almost 18 years. I found it to be healthier for my nails than acrylic. I tried the tabs, but they are too much trouble due to the length of my nails. I can cut this silk to fit my entire nail instead of using several of the tabs. The key to getting the silk to adhere to your nail is to use the right kind of glue. I ONLY use IBD-5 Second Nail Glue Professional, and not Nail Wrap or any other kind of glue. It seals the silk on your nail instantly, no slipping,

I've had long nails for some 30 years, and they are my own.  I attribute it to drinking LOTS of milk both when I was little, and now.  I've gotten so many compliments on my nails, and sometimes looks of disbelief when I tell someone they are my own...not acrylic or paste-on.  As I've gotten older, I've had to clip them to a 'workable' size, and I've used silk wrap for as long as I can remember.  That's why I'm so delighted to find a resource for silk wrap.  Just plain silk fabric, and you don't need alot to pop on your nail to strengthen it, protect it.  I also use crazy glue to keep it down.  You can also lightly file it off your nail on the edges, and it still does wonderfully.  It's a wonderful product!  Hahahahaha...the name on this review is my Dad, but I'm his daughter.
It is impossible for the glue to dry on the silk.  I waited up to 10 minutes and it was still slipping and sliding all over the nail.. I gave up

reviewText:
Just for the record, these are just green Mach3 blades (thus the M3 name for the razor I guess), though they claim the strip has some aloe vera on it. Really now!

I don't think the pretty color is worth the couple of bucks extra they charge.
I have a tough beard and have been using these blades for about 6 months. They are incredibly smooth and NO nicks or cuts! Also, they last longer than the others.
Gillette lost in a court of law regarding this product.  All it's claims for this product have essentially been proven FALSE.  Do not waste your money on this garbage!
description: PowerGlide Blades: A patented coating process produces a smooth blade surface for incredible glide and comfort.

Make sure you’re always stocked up on Gillette Mach3 Power refill cartridges. Experience the close, comfortable shave of M3Power®. The Gillette M3Power razor's sophisticated shaving system combines Gillette's 3 Blade Shaving Technology with PowerGlide blades, which gently glide across your face for a smooth, soothing shave. Experience the razor's forward-pivoting head with 10 Microfins that embrace every curve of your face.

Additional Product Features

*First four blades vs. Fusion.
**vs. Fusion® Manual.

How long will the Gillette Mach3 Power cartridge last?
How long a razor cartridge lasts varies from person to person, as it is dependent on many variables such as beard toughness and thickness, beard preparation, shaving habits, and skin sensitivity. The Gillette Mach3 Power Cartridges have an lubricating strip which will provide you with a visual cue — it fades to white — when shave conditions have been reduced. When this happens, you may want to consider changing the blade on your razor.

Will the Gillette Mach3 Power cartridge fit any other razors on the market?
The Gillette Mach3 Power cartridge features a razor blade that fits on any Gillette Mach3 Power, Mach3 Turbo, or Mach3 handle. All Mach cartridges can fit on all Mach handles.

Is it better to use hot, cold, or warm water to shave?
Warm water is best for hydrating beard hair. Soaking in warm water softens hair and causes it to expand, making it 70% easier to cut.

What is the best way to avoid razor burn?
If the skin is not properly prepared before shaving or if the blade on your razor is dull, you are more likely to end up with razor burn. Make sure to hydrate hair in warm water for up to three minutes and apply plenty of shave gel. Also, consider changing the blade on your razor at the first sign of dullness or discomfort.

Is it okay to let my girlfriend or wife borrow my men’s razor?
For both hygiene and performance, it's not a good idea to share your razor with your partner. Women have a much larger area to shave and you may find that after only a few shaves, your blade has dulled considerably; increasing the likelihood of nicks and cuts. Tell her to try a razor specifically designed for the way a woman shaves, such as Gillette Venus® Embrace®.

Does shaving make your hair grow back thicker?
Scientists at Gillette have conducted extensive testing on the effects shaving has on both male and female hair growth, texture, and color. This testing has proven that shaving does not affect hair growth, color, or texture. Shaving does, however, alter the tip shape of the regrown hair, which may initially change the way hair feels as it grows back. But if hair is left to regrow completely, it will return to its former state.

In what direction should I shave to achieve Gillette’s best shave?
Men’s facial hair tends to grow in different directions. Start by shaving with light, gentle strokes with the grain. Then, if necessary, go against the grain for a close shave.

What is the difference between disposable and refillable razors?
The entire razor is discarded when you are through with a disposable razor. With a refillable razor, only the blade cartridge is replaced. Refillable razors like Gillette Fusion ProGlide and Gillette Fusion incorporate more advanced blade technology and ergonomics vs. most disposables for great control and a close comfortable shave.

What are the differences between single, double, triple and 5-blade razors? Which is best?
Gillette's research has demonstrated that single blade technology, which has been applied since 1901, is demonstrably inferior to twin blade shaving systems such as Sensor Excel®, and even more so to 5-blade systems such as Gillette Fusion ProGlide. But the number of blades alone does not ensure a superior shave. The 5-blade shaving surface of Fusion ProGlide Manual and Fusion ProGlide Power features progressive blade alignment, an advanced blade coating process and a flexible comfort guard, which collectively provide Gillette's most comfortable shave.

How do I avoid nicks and cuts, particularly above my upper lip?
The area above the upper lip is tricky for many men. To help avoid nicks and cuts, always leave it for last. Apply plenty of shave gel and allow this area to soak up as much lather as possible. When shaving, don't apply too much pressure.
title: Gillette M3 Power Cartridges 8 Count

reviewText: I take one on a empty stomach 30 minutes before meals and another one after my workout for fast recovery
It is a vegan capsule and product does what it's says. For those who wish for a natural alternative to the "blues" this is it.

I've been taking this product for about two weeks, and I am amazed at how effectively it works to 1) elevate mood, 2) minimize irritability, and 3) decrease depression. After trying several different dose amounts at different times of day, I've settled on taking 680mg in the morning with breakfast (two caplets). I was having trouble going to sleep when taking this in evening, so morning works better for me. I also take 360mg of Ginkgo Biloba and 600mg of Panax Ginseng. In general, my mood thirty minutes after a dose is one of calm, clear, balanced, focused happiness. I think more clearly about whatever decisions I have to make, and it helps me to organize my thoughts to tackle the day's tasks. I highly recommend trying this if you're mild to moderately depressed, suffer from anxiety, or (like me) just get irked by jerky, aggressive, and unbalanced people too easily. Rhodiola seems to diminish sour mood. Coincidentally, I've seen my chess playing sharpen considerably. I've won or placed in the Top 3 in four chess tournaments the past two weeks. Concentration and focus is much improved. I think the combo of Rhodiola, Panax Ginseng, and Ginkgo Biloba is remarkable. Poke around online and read some of the peer-reviewed scientific articles on these herbs. There is compelling data on all three in a variety of scholarly journals. My typical dose (as described above) lasts at optimum for 4-6 hours.

reviewText: I have really sensitive skin and I have the pleasure of getting rosacea a couple years ago. There is blushing in my cheeks and get lesions around my mouth that scar. It's a pain. So, trying to find a face wash that doesn't send me rushing to find a bowl of ice to stick my face in has been a battle. Many washes I have tried makes me flare, usually within a day. The only one that doesn't is expensive and takes forever to ship. Forget trying to use any sort of brush or scrub to exfoliate so the blackheads on my nose tend to stay right where they are. Well, I have been using this a week and I am friggin' thrilled. The sponge is soft to the skin and leaves a smoothness I haven't felt with any sort of wash or scrub. I use it with the aforementioned wash in the evening to wash my makeup off or in the morning use it as is. Works beautifully both ways. Now, keep in mind this isn't the apricot, walnut type scrub that rips your face apart, this is gentle, feels gentle but gets the job done. Feels like a spa experience. Blackheads are reduced, no flare ups thus far, I feel clean and I feel like I'm glowing. I also bought the "Selfie Prep" wash from Castillo Acre and I can't wait to try it but with my skin, to try new things takes some prep..lol. I'm so happy I found this, it's been so hard to find good things for my spazzed out skin.

I love this sponge! I used it both with and without soap.  It left my skin so soft and smooth and I feel it did a good job getting my face clean without being harsh.  It was packaged beautifully and I love the instructions that were printed on a label inside the box.  I would definitely recommend this product and would buy it as a gift for my daughters - great stocking stuffer!

This natural sponge is amazing!  I found it very amusing to see it transform to hard as a rock to a squishy sponge. I was able to use it with a face soap called "Selfie Prep" product also made by Castillo Acre. This facial sponge made my face feel fantastic!. I have very sensitive skin even though the sponge exfoliates it is very gentle on the face. There are no dislikes about this product!!

Thanks Castillo Acre

reviewText: The oil seems to nourish my beard as well as other beard oils I have used. I wash my beard usually with an argan oil soap, then towel dry the beard once done with my shower. I run this comb, or a buffalo horn comb through my beard, to get out the knots and kinks. I love the fact that it comes with the beard comb - and oil. I sincerly appreciate it not leaving my beard dry and leaving it conditioned.

Recently there was a promotional deal and I was got the opportunity to take a look and try this out for myself so that I would provide some feedback and give my opinion here in my review.  This is something I do anyway, so I figured why not. Hopefully my review helps someone make a decision, and if you've got questions, drop a comment afterwards and I'll gladly reply.

I tried this stuff out this morning and it does a decent job of softening my beard without leaving it in a greasy state, so it does that pretty well, the applicator leaves something to be desired, an eyedropper doesn't really work well for this kind of product.  Another one I tried had a little hand pump which was better.  It seems kind of awkward either rubbing an eye dropper on your face or dropping oil into your hand.
The smell was not the best.  I'm assuming it is supposed to have no smell, but argan oil and jojoba both have a sharp smell to me that it's exactly unpleasant, but it's not delightful either.

The comb is not very useful for me, I have a short-ish beard and it seems this would have been more well suited to a longer bushier beard.  I prefer a boar bristle brush for even distribution of product in my beard, even when it is longer.

A few drops of a scented oil would make this a lot better.

This beard oil is made up of a nice combination of oils and works well.  I have been using beard oils for a while and this one works as well as many of the better ones I have bought.  For pretty close to the same price as other beard oils out there you get the comb with it as well.  I'll try to break down each piece in the kit as best I can.

The oil seems to nourish my beard as well as other beard oils I have used.  This one has castor oil, which I have read is good for eyelashes so I see no reason it will not work with beards.  I followed my normal routine after a shower before applying this beard oil.  I wash my beard usually with an argan oil soap, then towel dry the beard once done with my shower.  I run this comb, or a buffalo horn comb through my beard, to get out the knots and kinks.  I then add the beard oil to my hand about 5 to 10 drops - I have a long beard about 4 to 5 inches long - and apply to the underside of my beard and skin.  I then reload my hands with another 5 to 10 drops and hit the front side of my beard and then, run my fingers through my beard to try to get it as evenly dispersed as possibly.  I then run my comb through - both by this seller - through my beard to work out any knots or kinks I added.  Once done my beard is shiny, not greasy, and lays just right.

From my experience, maybe it is the hard water we have here, but It seems all beard oils eventually evaporate or disappear throughout the day.  It might be that I run my hands through my beard so I don't blame the oils for that.  Some oils seem to disappear really quickly, this oil seems to stay a little longer like the other oils I have used.

The comb is well made and much bigger than I expected.  I have a similar comb, I bought from a different seller, which is significantly smaller and not as well made.  Regarding the comb from this seller, I believe the comb might be made of peach wood.  I expected it to be smaller for some reason, probably because of my other comb, and was pleasantly surprised at the size and how substantial the comb is.  The comb is, sizes are approximates, 5 3/8" (138 mm) long by 2" (51 mm) high by 1/4" (7mm) thick along the spine of the comb.  The teeth taper down to about 1/8" (3mm) and the usable portion of the comb, teeth, is approximately 4 5/8" (118mm).  This comb is stout and holds up well to my long beard.  The brush will continue to darken over time due to the beard oils not only nourishing my beard but also the wood fibers.

I like to run this comb through my beard a few times a day to help keep the kinks and knots down to a minimum.  Plus the comb being made of wood you don't get the static you get with a plastic comb.

From what I can tell from the packaging, both the oil and comb are made in China.

All in all I am pleased with this oil and comb set and would consider buying again in the future.
title: Beard Comb with Beard Oil 2-in-1 Beard Grooming & Conditioner Set Kit for Men by M2 - Best Beard Care Product Combo makes perfect gift - Wood Comb & Oil with Vitamin E, Aloe Vera, Jojoba Carrier

The Baubax travel jacket is the most funded clothing project in the history of crowdfunding. With over 55K customers backing our crowdfunding campaigns, Baubax was featured in 70+ publications including CNN Money, Entrepreneur, Inc Magazine. The Baubax travel jacket comes with 15 features, including a neck pillow, eye mask, gloves, stylus pen, tech pockets and much more. Further note, our blazer and bomber jackets also come with detachable hoods. There are four styles of jackets available in both men and women cuts, with a variety of size and color options as well. Get yours now!
15 features for all of your travel needs

BauBax has solved all your traveler needs by including features that have been missing from other jackets in the past. The most economical and efficiently designed travel jacket on the market today. All BauBax jackets have a built-in inflatable neck pillow that hidden within the hood of the jacket. Innovative pillow valve technology allows a 2 SECOND INFLATION and a ONE PRESS DEFLATION. They also come with an eye mask, built-in gloves, earphone holders, neoprene lined Koozie drink pocket, a 10-inch tablet pocket, a water resistant smartphone pocket, a sunglass holder pocket with a built-in microfiber cloth for cleaning lenses, a passport pocket that accommodates all passport sizes, a zipper which is a telescopic pen and a stylus and two fleece lined hand warming pockets.

No matter the occasion, Baubax has you covered. Need a light windbreaker or something more formal for that business meeting? Baubax jackets are available in 4 styles: sweatshirts, windbreakers, bombers, and blazers. All 4 styles are offered in a variety of colors and sizes as well.
"The swiss-army knife of travel wear" - CNN Money Regardless the time of year, the BauBax jacket is your perfect travel tool.
We have identified and secured the best quality fabric manufacturers who are suppliers to the world's top apparel brands.
From coast to coast, short or long distance, school or work, we have a jacket style that will fit your needs.

What started out as a necessity for one person, turned into one of the most successful crowdfunding projects to date. This was the million-dollar idea of Yoganshi Shah and Hiral Sanghavi. Eventually their goal is to incorporate their background of electronics and software to create smart apparel!

Convenience on the go. That is what Yoganshi Shah thought of when her husband, Hiral Sanghavi, kept forgetting his neck pillow when he travelled. Initially together they thought maybe an app would work to keep a working packing list. Yoganshi had a brilliant idea of creating a jacket that essentially embodies everything has a place, and everything in its place. The outcome was a functional jacket designed for accessibility and comfort. The BauBax jacket has 15 features that helps all travelers and people on-the-go stay organized with pockets for a tablet, smart phones, sunglasses, and even a drink pocket. To add to the overall functionality, there is space to hold earphones, built-in eye mask, gloves that extend from the sleeves, and comes with a microfiber cloth to keep all eyewear sparkly clear. Of course it has the built-in neck pillow that will not be left at home again.
You likely never heard of a travel jacket before Baubax, but it's the jacket you always needed but never existed.
It is good to have clothing that solves problems you face in your day-to-day life. We are happy that Baubax is doing that for tens of thousands of customers worldwide.

I have ordered wigs from this company before and I will say they are a great value, very high quality for the price and they fit my enormous head for the most part which is hard to find.

HOWEVER
I can't stand that they say the package has shipped almost immediately but they don't actually get it to the post office for weeks! Once again I needed a wig before an event and I assumed since they gave me a tracking number and said it had shipped that it would be here soon. But no, they don't actually send it out for weeks. It drives me crazy because I have the tracking number but never any information. I will say that once the wigs get to the post office they get here quickly, they just need to get it to the post office faster. Last time they told me to ignore the amazon arrival date because it would get here long before that. Well, I waited for a month or so and finally on the second day of the amazon arrival date they finally took it to the post office.

Other than that great place to buy wigs, just hope you're not in a rush cause their logistics kinda suck

reviewText:
But now I'm not, for sure. I have tough skin, so shaving with a razor never left cuts for me. But it was a mixed blessing, because shaving with a razor, indeed, caused a rather bad acne problem until I switched to waxing for almost two years.

Waxing was great, but a pain to preform -- So I finally decided to spend my birthday money on an electric razor. All my friends insisted I'd regret it, and that they don't work. The whole usual spiel about getting a rash, and just wasting my money. But being the stubborn person I am, I had to find out for myself.

As usual, my friends were full of it.

First of all, not only do I not get acne with an electric razor, *but* I never got any rashes or irriation, even during the first week I used it. I have dark, black facial hair, that is somewhat thinned out due to the waxing. But they're also hard and 'fine'.

The electric, no, isn't literally as close as a true hand razor. But it's close enough for the conveniance -- It's quicker than a blade for me, and easier since I don't have to sit there digging hairs out of the blades so I could continue shaving.

I run it under warm water when I shave. For the lotion, it's great, but I have to be honest -- I barely use it. I use a pea-sized drop for each side of my face, and then the rest of the experience is all warm water. It works great, though, and I have no complaints. Not to mention that I've been using one lotion pouch for *weeks* now... But I guess I should mention I only need to shave every 2-3 days, not every day. A little stubble never hurt anyone. (And being a musician, I don't have to worry about leaving a good impression on office types.)

Overall I'm surprisingly satisfied. I also admittedly chose this one because it's an awesome green. My only REAL complaint is that, considering the nature of this razor, I can't shave between for my eyebrows. So for this, I've now gotten into the routine of tweezing, if only to avoid the putrid unibrow.

I bought this shaver about a month ago because I'd had enough of cutting myself with my viscious Gillette Mach 3. Three cuts at a time on the cheek. Ouch! The good news is that I have no regrets buying this Cool Skin and I don't think I'll be going back to the Mach 3 any time soon. Like all things tho', pluses and minues:

Pluses:

- No more cuts.

- Shaves as close as my Mach 3 with less irritation.

- I can shave in the shower, which is absolutely essential!

- Great looking shaver, and one of the few that doesn't look like my grandfather's. The green color is super cool, and my wife thinks it has even improved the look of our shower!

- Very easy to clean under running water in the shower.

- One charge lasts a week or more.

Minuses:

- Takes about 2 - 3 three times as long as shaving with a razor.

- I don't mind the cost of the Nivea refills that much (see below), it's the waste generated by the empty sachets that bugs me. I wish they could have developed a refillable dispenser.

- The "advanced LED display" is pointless. Do I really need a flashing light to tell me to rinse the razor at the end of every shave? Or do I need another light that flashes to tell me I can pump lotion just after the thing's switched on? If it weren't for that great green color I could have bought the cheaper model and got the same functionality at less cost. All you really need is a low battery indicator.

- You pump the lotion or gel onto the heads with your finger or thumb. Using my finger gave me cramp in my hand. Using the thumb is OK. A more advanced design would be to have the lotion delivered automatically.

Finally, what about the lotion and gel? I found both worked fine. At a pinch I've also used ordinary shaving foam and even just water applied directly to my face. The most comfortable and closest shave is however obtained using the gel or lotion. I just bought a 5-pack of lotion at Target for $4.99. One sachet lasts me 4 or 5 shaves if I'm fairly frugal with it. So that works out at about 25c per shave which isn't too bad.

All in all recommended for those who are thinking of switching from razor to electric.

I ordered this shaver for my husband to replace his older Norelco Quadra. After trying it, we are returning it to Amazon. He says his old Quadra works better than the 7745X Cool Skin. It looks cool and the wet shave is nice but it takes longer to shave and the closeness is not up to expectations. The new shaver should shave as good or better than the older models. The shaver does work so if you don't have an electric shaver, this might be okay for you. My husband has dark, coarse hair and the blades just weren't "cutting it." Fine, light colored hair might improve the performance but, my advice is to look for something else in the same price range.

Maybe our expectations were too high or the shaver really is lacking in performance. There was only one review when we made the purchase and maybe this will help others out there before money is wasted.
description: Norelco's Cool Skin Razors can be used in or out of the shower. Cool Skin shaves as close as a blade with less irritation when using the HQ170 lotion cartridges. The convenience of an electric without the nicks and cuts of a blade! The Cool Skin Razor dispenses Nivea for Men Shaving Lotion or Gel that sets your beard up for an unexpectedly close and comfortable wet shave, leaving your face feeling smooth and refreshed.

reviewText:
These Tattify Skeleton Nail Wraps from Tattify are actually a really cute product but they just didn't work for us. My teenage daughter tried to apply them on her nails but they didn't want to stay on at all. Kind of a bummer.

I received this product for free or at a discount for my honest and unbiased review.

I have had experience with Jamberry Nails and this product is very similar except for one big thing. It does not require any heat to apply. The product comes with the sticker sheet with several sizes of nail stickers. It also comes with a set of directions a wooden cuticle pusher and a nail file. The concept is simple. All you have to do is cut the nail sticker to fit your nail and you peel and stick. Any edges that are too long you can use your nail file to precisely cut it along your nail Edge. I was a bit skeptical about this product as it does not require Heat and is basically just a sticker. I have had the product on for a couple days and have not had any lifting or any stickers removed. A couple of the leftovers I cut and put on my daughter's big toes. Which swimming and her bath they have also stage put. One thing I did notice with the skulls is that I put them upside down. The design is facing me instead of facing away from me. I noticed when I was done that the skulls bottom jaw and the school's head should be able to meet when you put your thumb and forefinger together. Also if you cut the sticker a little short from the edges of your nails you cannot tell a big difference. And I was able to easily do this to my right hand with my left and there was no drying time. I received this item at a discounted rate for my honest review.

The nail wraps were too wide for my nails. The part that is supposed to align with your cuticles is way too rounded oddly shaped for my nail bed. It's also like it starts too narrow down there, so there's slight gapping along the edges, then it becomes too wide for my fingers. The instructions were too hard to get out of the package, so I had to shred the packaging just to get to them.

*I received this item at a discount for my honest opinion.
title: Tattify Skeleton Nail Wraps - Let's Bone (Set of 22)

reviewText: Hasn't "cured" my KP as other reviews claim, not that I expected it to cure it, but I thought it would at least help.  Doesn't really do much of anything.  Way overpriced for what you're getting.

It does not work well enough to justify the $70 price.  I'm not even certain that it worked - nothing came off without also using oil and a very long soak.  And even then, it may have just been dirt mixed with the oil (i.e. oil cleansing).

After trying many exfoliation methods, I found I prefer soaking clean skin in Epson Salt. Then using a clean, warm, wrung out washcloth for a firm slow scrub.  The skin sloughs off in rolls of dead skin that can be easy rinsed away.

Though admittedly, using Le Edge with oil left my skin feeling clean & well moisturized with less effort.  It just didn't feel 'exfoliated'.

This is a simple and innovative tool in removing dead skin from your face and body. I have been using loofahs and sponges to exfoliate my skin and I have to replace it every two months because it's a favorite breeding place of bacteria. I also use a blackhead or whitehead prick tool and pore strips but I find them ineffective in exfoliating all the unwanted dirt. It also resulted for my pores to get enlarged. With the Le'Edge exfoliator, I can easily remove the dirt off my face and body. It has a blunt stainless steel edge which, at first, I was a little bit skeptical to use because I thought it was gonna hurt but it doesn't as long as you don't rub it too hard against your skin. It really does an effective job. All I needed to do is glide it gently on my skin and it removes excess gunk from deodorants and lotion. It also removes all the whiteheads on my face leaving my skin soft and smooth. I only use this 2 times a week to avoid over-exfoliating my skin. It also doesn't take a lot of time to exfoliate because I am assured that all the dirt is removed from my body and skin. It has a non-slip rubber grip which makes it easier to handle while you are in the shower. This has to be used in the shower or while your skin is warm and your pores is still open from taking a warm bath or shower. It is easy to clean, lightweight and compact so you can bring it with you whenever you go. I highly recommend this body and facial cleaning tool! I have to disclose that I received this product at a promotional discount or for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
title: Le Edge Full Body Exfoliator - Black with Gold Print (Limited Edition)

reviewText: I broke out in hives after using this product. First time in my life to have such a poor reaction to skin care.

Yes, the box is printed in Chinese.  I don't know why people are bewildered.  Everyone knows how to use face wash, right?  Directions aren't really necessary for something like this....

Here's what I'd want to know:

Does it clean well?  Yes.  I have oily skin, and this took the remains of the days off without leaving my skin tight.

Does it smell good?  Not really, but it doesn't smell bad either.  It's clean---but it doesn't appeal to me personally.

Is it a pleasure to use?  Yes.  It's a cream texture--and pea sized blob produces a lot of lather.  It seems to rinse well.  I don't look forward to using it because I don't love the smell, but it takes makeup off quickly.

Does it outperform drugstore level cleansers?  No.  I've used many face washes like this in the past.  It reminds me of the Neutrogena Naturals Purifying Cream Cleanser ($7.99 for 5oz) which I didn't love.  This cleanser is pleasant enough.....but it's not anything I would rush out to buy again.

---Promotional sample provided for the purpose of candid and objective review.---

This works great as a cleanser and smells awesome! It is easy to use just like any other cleanser and it is a good decent sized bottle! The smell is definitely the best part, it is awesome! It also does a great job cleaning my face and making it feel new! However, my gripe with this is that all of the directions and printing are mostly in a foreign language. That's super whack and unprofessional and does take away from the product. However, the packaging and everything else about the product seems to be very good!
*I received this product in exchange for an honest, unbiased review
title: SOONPURE Hyaluronic Acid Cleanser 100g

reviewText: Daughter loves this product.

reviewText: I absolutely love my eye shadow!  Very happy with the whole process from ordering it, to receiving it!  Can't rave enough about this product!

Let me preface this by saying that the colors are pretty and generally well pigmented (I use it with Too Faced Shadow Insurance).  My issue is that many of the colors are very glittery - I like shimmery shadows, but we are talking big chunks of glitter here in several of the colors.  If you're familiar with Urban Decay's "Midnight Cowgirl" shadow family you'll get the picture.  Basically the entire palette is gliterry, except for two matte shades. If you get this, make sure to put a tissue under your eyes to catch the fall-out or you'll look like a disco ball.  I'm talking serious fall-out here.

The colors are:

Full Moon: Glittery Champagne
Night Light:  Supremely Glittery rosey pink (this one has a chalky texture, making it impossible to apply without massive fallout.)
Spotlight: Matte Beige
Nightcap: Shimmery medium tan
After Hours:  Chalky glittery medium beige
Moonstone:  Glittery deep tan
Cocoa Star:  Matte chocolate brown
Eclipse: Glittery Chestnut brown
Night Fever: Glittery Chocolate brown

The positives:  The packaging is cute, the colors are fairly pigmented, Too Faced includes looks cards so you can get ideas on looks.

The negatives:  This is only a good palette if you already have a nice collection of eyeshadow and you want something to throw in your purse when you're going out of town and know you'll be partying (and you have the patience to deal with massive fallout).  You can definitely make some work appropriate looks, but these are more glittery than shimmery, making it a bit juvenile.  Some of the shadows are chalky too. I also have the Urban Decay Naked palette and the colors are MUCH better, as is the quality of the shadows.  Personally I think Naked is also a better deal.  It's $50, so $14 more, but you get more colors, the shadows are better quality (creamier and smoother), and it comes with a nice brush.

I find that I don't use this palette much.  It isn't a palette that has an obvious place in my makeup collection.

Updated:  I am still experimenting with this palette (I brought it in my makeup bag on vacation and left my UD Naked palette at home) and I've definitely created some nice looks that are completely appropriate for daily life.  I just don't LOVE it.  The problem is, I have the Urban Decay Naked palette.  The colors are similar between UD Naked and TF Natural at Night (warm browns and champagnes) but the Urban Decay colors are shimmers (I love shimmers) and many of the shads in the Too Faced Naked at Night palette are glitters.  That makes the TF colors much harder to work with due to fallout.  Ultimately, this palette is 3.5 stars to me.  It has nice colors and you can create some great looks (provided you put tissue under your eyes to catch the fallout), but the UD Naked Palette is just better in my opinion in terms of pigmentation, ease of application, and blending.

I wouldn't change a thing about this pallet. If you love neutral eyeshadow colors this is for you. It has the perfect mix of shimmer and matte eyeshadow and the packaging is great if you are low on storage.

reviewText: Really nice feeling in the face and allows you to see where are you shaving. It is not as soft as using cream
This is the raddest shaving serum I've ever used! Kills bacteria, cleans, ensures a smooth shave, and has a pleasant odour. Gentlemen, panties shall drop. This is GOOD STUFF.

A sample was sent to me for test and evaluation purposes.  This man-specific shaving serum is very different from the more familiar shaving foams and gels that my husband normally buys.  For a start, the airless pump container requires priming the pump, meaning you have to expel all the air out of the bottle before the contents start to come out in any quantity.  Once done, the fairly viscous clear gel is delivered in short burst.  Although tempted to pile it on thickly, my husband started with an amount similar to an almond and found it to be quite sufficient to address a week-old growth.

I felt the consistency of the serum applied to damp skin, and it reminded me more of a face cream than a shaving product, but I have to say, the razor was gliding very easily, leaving behind soft, smooth, bare skin.  Once the shaving was done, a little rinsing with clear water produced a milky white residue which was quickly absorbed.  The scent is delicious, a little sweet until body chemistry adapts it, but I detected vanilla and some of the lighter herbal elements.

The ingredients include some lovely botanical compounds like rice bran oil, sunflower oil, extracts of yarrow, peppermint, melissa and mallow, vitamin E and coumarin, a phytochemical responsible for the vanilla-like scent.  The blurb says it's a multi-purpose product that can also be used as a face wash and moisturizer, so it would be useful on a trip when luggage space is at a premium, but my husband is going to use it strictly for shaving, since there is also a very creamy moisturizer in the range.  If you find it a bit pricey, consider that the 50 g will last you a lot longer than comparable gels based on artificial soapy compounds.  This brand does not test on animals and is committed to natural ingredients as far as possible; I appreciate the honesty and the intent.
description:

reviewText: I wanted the rosemary leave in lice repel and purchased this detangling spray by accident. I decided to keep it and try it since I liked the rosemary repel I had used previously, also by Fairy Tales. This antistatic spray is awful. The first time you use it it smells pretty good. However, my kids (4&6) don't shower everyday.. so I use a detangler (this) in the morning to comb their hair and neaten it up. If you use this more than once in between washes, it creates a really bad odor and the hair gets sticky and dirty looking, and is even more difficult to comb. If you are only using it occasionally or once in between washes it might be okay, but otherwise this is nasty stuff. I wish I could send it back! The rosemary leave in repel on the other hand can be used for several days with out these problems. Hope this review was helpful.
This is a very good product.  It is easy to use and effective.  I have used it for many years.

My 4 and 7 year old daughters and I love this detangling spray.  It never weighs our hair down, and we have from very fine and not much hair to lots of fine straight hair to lots of fine wavy hair.  We have been using this spray for many years and also love the repel spray to keep the bugs away.  I have nothing bad to say about this product.

reviewText: slightly thicker material than expected, but it is AWESOME. I'd have to get one size larger shoes to wear with these socks.

I'm a size 7 women's and they fit a tiny loose on the foot but if I just wash and dry they will shrink. Don't let this stray you from buying though I absolutely LOVE these socks and wish I had a ton more pairs just a tad expensive.

I don't have anything bad to report about this product, I just want to clarify something for potential new buyers.  These are SOCKS, not liners, not stocking like, not knee high like, not like the material of other peds.  They are socks.  I thought I was getting something that might have the thickness and weight of a tight but it is definitely a sock material.  Soft - yes, comfortable - yes, just not what I expected.  Maybe I should have known, after all sock is in the title, but considering they were compared to peds I guess I just jumped to the wrong conclusion.

Utilizing high-quality Coolmax polyester helps protect your feet from the rubbing that can cause blisters, as well as wick moisture away keeping your feet cool and dry. These no show socks are a MUST for every woman's closet! Don't let the fall, winter, or cold offices dissuade you from wearing your favorite heels or flats. Don't Slip, Don't Show

reviewText:
I have an inverted bob, fine texture, and color-treated. This is one of the few flat irons I've used that my hair doesn't fall out of while I'm pulling it through. The slide bar to raise/lower temperature is a little confusing at first, but I guess after a few uses I'll know which way to push it...it's also a little temperamental in adjusting it. I love the long swivel cord and the Velcro band you attach after it's cooled down so it stays closed in the drawer.

[Sample]

If I could give this straightener more stars I would.  I am always hesitant when it comes to hair appliances that are by unknown brands.  I always tend to use well known brands such as FHI, CHI, Sudo, etc.  However  the ease of use, functions and overall performance of the Ivation Professional Flat Iron has out performed and exceeded my expectations over my $200+ flat irons.

The touch sensitive controls are located inside the handles so no more accidentally turning the temperature down or annoying beeps because most digital displays have the controls outside where your fingers are constantly touching them.  To control the temperature and power, just lightly place your finger over the power icon or slide it up or down to control the temperature on the touch control panel.

It is truly amazing how quickly it heats up to your desired temperature.  You can watch the blue LED screen rapidly count up from 76 to 450 degrees in less than one minute.  This flat iron will glide over your hair like silk. It will leave you hair silky smooth and full of shine. Tourmaline ceramic plates produces far infra-red heat to release negative ions which reduces static and helps seal the cuticle to make your hair smoother and shiner. Tourmaline flat irons are highly recommended if you have really curly or frizzy hair.  Of course, even though using tourmaline ceramic plates can protect hair from high heat damage and breakage, you should always use a heat protection spray or product in your hair before flat ironing.

Comes with a VERY long 9 foot swivel cord.  It is extremely lightweight.

Automatically turns off if left unattended for 30 minutes.

Comes with a one-year warranty.

Review sample.
great product
description: Enjoy Amazing Salon-Grade Results at Home

Get ready to put salon waiting lists and expensive appointments behind you. This professional flat iron hair straightener from Ivation will put the power and high heat of the tools used by pros right in your hands. Moreover, it is so easy to use that you'll be creating the hottest new hairstyles mere minutes after you open the box. The 1-inch plates float,meaning they pivot during all your curling, waving and flipping to maintain optimal contact with every strand without pulling on or damaging your hair. The result? You'll feel beautiful and confident as you easily transform frizzy, dull hair into gorgeous locks.

The plates are coated in ceramic with tourmaline for a number of benefits. Ceramic transfers heat faster and more evenly than steel, and also holds heat better from one curl to the next. In fact, this flat iron heats in a matter of seconds up to any heat level. As tourmaline is a natural source of far-infrared heat and negative ionic energy, it also softens and protects your hair for longer shine and bounce. Best of all, the flat iron features a unique elliptical shape that makes it suitable for so much more than simple hair straightening. Experiment with glam waves, bouncy curls or something entirely new.

Whatever your hair type, the digital touch control interface makes it easy to select the perfect heat level: Touch to turn on and off, and swipe right and left to adjust heat in increments of 20F. With a pro-grade maximum heat output of 450F, you can tackle any style you want and even enjoy Brazilian keratin treatments. A super-bright digital display provides the temperature readout in cool blue digits, necessitating no more than a glance to ensure your iron is at the heat level you want it.
title: Ivation Professional Flat Iron Hair Straightener w/Premium Floating, Tourmaline-Ceramic Plates – Super-Fast Heating up to 450°F Degrees in Just 60 Seconds, Perfect for Brazilian Keratin Treatments – Crystal-Clear Temperature Display & Touch-Sensitive Controls – The Ultimate Flat Iron, Hair Curler, Hair Straightener/Styler for Effortlessly Gorgeous Hairstyles

reviewText: I love this product smells great works great gives a great cool after shave feeling one thing I do have to say is that it is strong and it will overpower whatever cologne you put on so I wish it came in a lighter scent but the same scent . But other than that it works great been buying it for years .

HEY!! I am an Aqua Velva Man and absolutely love this stuff, been using it for over 50 years. This is a true after shave lotion classic. Not quite sure how many women that have been attracted to me because of Aqua Velva,  I do know for sure that it's just to many to count. Ha.  Not sure how long this has been around but the Williams Company ran a paper advertisement, taken from a 1949 magazine, which features Ralph Bellamy of Detective Story and Ezio Pinza of South Pacific for Aqua Velva After Shave Lotion. I'm sure you all remember Ralph Bellamy and Ezio Pinza from the 40's right.

There slogan was " There is nothing like an AQUA VELVA MAN " and it seemed to work because this was a hot item when I was a young man. It's just amazing that this is still around when the vast majority of after shave lotions from that time period have disappeared over the years.

The only negative about Aqua Velva is it does not last very long. Usually in less than an hour the aroma has dissipated. The more expensive after shave lotions and perfumes have Ambergris in them which is quite expensive and comes from a sperm whale this enables the aroma to linger much longer.

At any rate this is a great classic after shave with a wonderful refreshing odor, give it a try you might just like it.

Note :::; Some reviewers mention this 7oz size now comes in a plastic container, I just bought one in Wal-Mart and it was glass.

I love Aqua Velva and have used it over 20 years but I tell you the truth I hate your new 7 oz bottle of plastic or whatever it is, give me the glass one back.  The new plastic spills more than you can use and there is no way you can control how much comes out and what you can capture in the palm of your hand.  I really do hate the new bottle, can't you give us a choice of bottles in 7 oz size.
description: After Shave for a Soothing Experience With Aqua Velva Classic Ice Blue Cooling After Shave, experience the coolness and freshness of icy blue. Containing the classic American fragrance, this after shave lotion is a favored product for men on the go. It keeps you fragrant all day long and comes in a classic, shatter proof bottle. This after shave lotion also firms and tones masculine skin. So, get ready to impress with this after shave. Handed down through generations, Aqua Velva is part of the longstanding ritual of a father teaching his son about the ritual of shaving. I am a mother of three children so I'm sure you can imagine the stretch marks that have accumulated on my sides and stomach over the years. I was a bit skeptical because I mean seriously some of these stretch marks are 26 years old so I was thinking they are never going to do anything to make them look better. I've been using the ColCutem Scar and stretch mark serum for about 2 weeks. I'm not going to say that my stretch marks are disappearing but they do seem lighter and the redness seems to be fading. You'll have to take my word for it because there's no way I'm taking a picture of them :) .
The serum is not sticky it does feel a bit early when you first put it on your skin and you definitely do need to rub it in for a few minutes as they Direct on the bottle but once it's absorbed into your skin it leaves it very soft. And the scent is actually not bad it has more of a natural floral scent to it not a medicated stent. I'm looking forward to the continued use see if the stretch marks do start to fade more.

This is a 4 ounce bottle with a nice pump that distributes the serum. You don't need to use a lot of it like I said I have stretch marks on my sides and my belly from babies and two squirts are definitely enough to cover cover the whole area. I'm assuming if it can give me this type of reaction to my older stretch marks that it may possibly work better for more recent stretch marks

***This I don't was received at no cost in exchange for my unbiased and honest opinion. Did this review is based solely on my personal experience using this product.

reviewText: great durable and sturdy

These are great glass spray bottles. I recevied s set of the Clear Glass Refillable 8 Oz Bottles to review.  I have been using natural products to clean and do other household tasks for some time, but it only been in the last few months that I have been exploring mixing things to create powerful cleaners, air fresheners and laundry aids. These are great bottles for many many things. The glass is thick and durable. One of the things I have used in them is water with lavender essential oil. I use this to spray the mattresses when we strip the sheets off. I don't saturate the mattress, but just spray over it and let the mist settle onto it. I also spray it into the air in our bedrooms a few times a week. These beat the cheap plastic bottles that have sprayers that break or mysteriously stop working from one use to the next. I also like using peppermint oil in water for a fresh, energizing room spray (also good for dusting to remove and discourage spider webs!).  The chalk labels are practical for remember what you have mixed up and for what purpose. They wash clean so you can change the label anytime you change the contents.
These are perfect for mixing up a nice amount that will last a bit, but not so much that you might need to pour it out for something new. The trigger feels a little odd at first because it has an almost up and down movement versus the back and forth movement of most triggers. There is a button lock on the neck the trigger that locks and unlocks it . One thing they don't have that is usually an option on most triggers, is there is no spray adjustment to switch between a stream or fine spray. It is a mist/fine spray.
I am loving using glass bottles over plastic very much. It takes a little extra care not to break them, but it's worth it. These can be used over and over again with out worry the material breakdown that plastic has and glass does contain any of the harmful chemicals of plastic.

I'm quite impressed with the clear glass refillable spray bottles. To be honest, the main reason I wanted these was for the bottles, not so much the labels. I don't have chalk so I can't really use them. Instead I used other labels that I had. The bottles are a great size for DIY cleaning spray. I mixed vinegar and water for a multi-purpose spray. The sprayer works fairly well. I really like that these bottles are glass because it'll allow you to reuse them many times. It makes it easier to clean the bottles out, too. The chalk labels seem decent, but for me, they won't be used.

Overall, I'm impressed with the clear glass refillable spray bottles and would definitely recommend them. There's so many uses for these bottles.

I did receive these bottle in exchange for honest opinion. Despite that, my thoughts were not influenced.
title: 8oz Clear Glass Refillable Spray Bottles with Reusable Chalk Labels (2 Pack)

So, I got the black one step gel polish. It did the job in one step, however with out a top coat it created uncured pockets, kind of weird, never seen gel polish do this. But I did one hand with a top coat and one without to test it. I don't know if it was the extra cure time for the top coat or the actual top coat that did it, but the ones that have a top coat didn't bubble where the ones without did. I'm gonna try another test make with a longer cure time for the first coat. reviewText: This is very easy to use and is great for using when doing stamping. The only thing that I'm iffy about is that the brush head is long and very thin, which is great for getting close on the cuticle, but not great for covering the rest of the area where the stamped polish will get.
My kids love doing nails but make quite a mess every time.  Now that we have this product there is no more mess.

I bought this set straight from the maker's web site after using the normal size and shape bottle. The thinner brush (striping) in these bottles allow for much closer application to the nail without being so messy like the full sized brush. The smaller sized bottle also saves lots of product, if not all of it, from drying out too soon.

Amongst cuticle/skin barriers from Bundle Monster, Simply Peel, Sally Beauty, latex, and various recipes of school glue + water, the best ready-made formula is this one, the Bundle Monster Latex Poli-Peel. And it has the best brush, the best bottle, and the best 'ready notice'.

Having it pink, or any color, is far better than nearly clear with a little glitter like Simply Peel. Since it has a color it's easy to tell where its been applied so there's much less chance of an oops. The glitter-when-ready approach of Simply Peel is still way too difficult to notice. In all fairness, a drop or two of food color fixes the problem of being able to see where it's applied but it does not address the glitter-when-ready. Bundle Monster Latex Poli-Peel is the way to go all around and hands down.
title: BMC Latex Poli-Peel Cuticle Protector Nail Art Polish Accessory-Precision Brush

reviewText: Great idea...someone really put their thinking cap on here - no more wasted conditioner or wasted money for shaving cream and the scent is delicious! Also, love that all cartridges are interchangeable with venus wands even if they are 5 years old...or so. lol.

These cartridges are very good quality.  They give a very comfortable and smooth shave.  The scent smells wonderful while the cartridge is wet, but does not seem to linger once you're done shaving.  That is not a problem for me because I use lotions afterward.  I purchase these regularly through the subscribe and save program.

Loved the clean shave it gave me, it did seem to moisturize my skin a bit more than usual, but I still needed some lotion after shaving (I have very dry skin though, so that could be all it was).  Didn't have a strong 'sugarberry' scent to it, which was fine by me because it was very subtle.  I've used it about four times so far and the bars on the top and bottom are wearing down already. I had the problem with a previous 'self lathering' head from Gillette where the bars would break off before they were fully used up, thus making it just another razor.  It's looking like that's happening to this one too.  But even with all that, I do love this however long it lasts and it really does give a much better shave than a 'plain' head.

reviewText:
After reading the reviews at Amazon.com and at a site that reviews electric razors, I choose the Braun 6520.  It was rated high and its price was half of the leading razor.  I also crossed check the price against other retailers and Amazon.com was [less expensive] and shipped one day sooner.
I have a tough beard that grows fast coupled with a tender face.  My Remington 300 was the first razor to allow me to use an electric shaver and make it through the day without looking like a beatnik; however, after 5 years the screens are impossible to find so it was time for a new shaver.  The new Braun came as advertised and was charged up the very first time in only 4 hours versus 14 for my old 300.  The charged and low charge lights are handy and the ability to charge a dead razor for a shave in 3 minutes is a great advantage.  I have found in the past that a preshave liquid improves the closeness of the shave and that has been true with the Braun as well.  By the third day my face had adjusted to the shaver and I am getting the closest shave ever with no skin irritation.  The shaver also does a great job with neck hairs and the occasional long hair.  One significant reason that I selected this razor was the changing of the screen and cutters at 18 months.  My old 300 required a screen or screen/cutter replacement every 6 months so this saves $30 over that 18 month period.  When selecting a razor be sure to pay attention to this or any "self-cleaning" liquids that you have to purchase on a regular basis.  The 6520 uses a floating head but is switchable to lock the head for hard areas like under the nose.  I found that I still get the best shave by moving my hand against the grain of the hair before I run the shaver there and you will want to shave against the grain too.  This was required with my old 300 and is indicative of most foil razors.  This is not required of rotary shavers but most research that I read indicates that a foil provides a closer shave.
I am very happy with this razor.  It works great!

Braun 6520 is the best electric shaver made. I've tried a
Remington and it is junk, you get a excellent smooth shave,
just as good as a razor blade. I recommend the Braun 6520, to
all men that are using razor blades, you will never use a razor blade again.

Most men say that the only way to get rid of those neck hairs is with a rotary razor. It's NOT TRUE! I get an excellent and thorough shave every mourning. I've tried the rest, but Braun is the BEST! One charge seeems to last forever. I take it camping with me for a week or so ....no problem.
description: This electric razor has a head that oscillates from side to side at high speed and pivots to adjust to the face's contours. In addition, the razor offers a three-stage cutting system and delivers a smooth shave either with or without a cord. The razor has a pop-up trimmer for mustache and sideburns and works worldwide on 110- to 240-volt systems. It recharges fully in one hour for 60 minutes of shaving time or charges in three minutes for a quick shave. The three-stage cutting system consists of a cutting block between two foils, with each unit performing individually as the razor runs across the face. For difficult shaving areas, such as under the nose, the pivoting head locks into position. The shaver carries a 30-day, full-refund guarantee and a two-year warranty against defects (foil and cutter block excluded). --Fred Brack
title: Braun 6520 Flex Integral Ultra Speed Rechargeable Shaver
